page.title: 19MR. PALMER (continued)
page.content: boats and they came from shore and took the three men. The child asked Mr. Palmer if she could go back to the Windbound with him and David (a 12 year old boy.) They went to shore then went to the Windbound for a drink. Mr. Palmer told us an interesting fact about the Severn Bore, the Severn Bore needs a strong tide to come past the lighthouse.The front of the Bore chases lots of fish down the Severn, so it is a good time to go fishing. When Mr. Palmer came to his house near the lighthouse, it was all like a wilderness to him. All he saw was a few farm carts and farmers, it was a very lonely place. Mr. Palmer once met Prince Charles when he visited Purton in 1973.
